body.p:
Yours of the 18th just came
to hand this morning just as I was about
starting for the court house, and as I was
liable to be fined one hundred dollars for not
being in my place in time, I did not even
stop to read my letters before going. At an
early moment after reaching the court house
I opened my letters and was particularly interested
with yours and one other at least.
Yours relieved my mind with regard
to the chair and the other one contained
an order for 48 U.G.R.R. books.

Of course I should have complied
with your request with regard to sending
it today (“Wednesday”) I had been at liberty
so to do. It shall be sent Thursday (tomorrow)
however. It was out of our power to
come up Saturday last and I am almost
afraid to promise you that we will
come next Saturday, yet if it clears
up nicely before then I rather think you
will see us if we come. I went up on the
6 o’clock boat last Saturday to Burlington and
passed the evening and best part of Sunday at
Aunt Vina’s and returned again Sunday eve.

If we shall decide to come this week
you will most likely get a letter from
me on Friday or Saturday morning.
